title: What's the difference between 遗忘 and just 忘? - Quora

response.answer_text: 忘 means to forget. past tense is 忘了，or forgot.  忘 is often used in the active voice.  e.g. 你忘了？(did you forget?)  别忘了！(don't foreget!)  不好意思， 我忘了带我的作业。 (sorry, I forgot to bring my homework.) 遗忘 means long forgotten, and is often used in the passive voice. It usually has to do with long-term memory.   e.g. 十年之内那副画肯定会被人们遗忘。（Within ten years, that painting will certainly be wiped off from people's memories.)

In my experience 忘 (wang4) isn't used by itself much in daily conversation.  It carries the notion of forget or of neglect.    遗忘 yi2wang4, means to forget or forgotten without the idea of neglect.  忘了 wang4le5 or 忘记了 wang4ji4le5 are both more common in daily speech for "have forgotten",  although both also can carry the notion of "neglected"  or "overlooked". Maybe one of the Chinese language instructors in Quora can improve this answer with some background on methods for expressing forgetting and forgetfulness?
